org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface TaskFactoryDefiner


  • public interface TaskFactoryDefiner
    Allows to define task node factories to build a task graph from. Note that having a task factory defined not in itself will cause a node to be created. It will just add the possibility for a node to be created.

    Task factories are uniquely identified by their associated TaskFactoryKey within the same TaskGraphDefConfigurer.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this interface may not necessarily safe to be used from multiple threads concurrently (though some implementations might choose to allow concurrent access).

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent in general.
    See Also:
    TaskGraphDefConfigurer

    • Method Detail

      • defineFactory

        <R,I> TaskFactoryConfig<R,I> defineFactory(TaskFactoryKey<R,I> defKey,
                                           TaskFactorySetup<R,I> setup)
        Adds deferred task node factory definition. If you do not need to create the task node factory lazily, you should consider using the more convenient defineSimpleFactory method. The deferred task node factory creation is useful if the creating the a factory is not cheap and might not be needed.

        If a task node factory was already defined with the given key, it will be replaced by the new definition. Even if, it was defined via a defineSimpleFactory method, or another TaskFactoryDefiner of the same TaskGraphDefConfigurer.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the task nodes created by the defined task node factory.
        I - the type of the argument passed to the task node factory when requested for a node to be created
        Parameters:
        defKey - the key uniquely identifying a task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        setup - the call creating the task node factory (i.e., the factory of the task node factory). This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the task node factory definition previously associated with the given factory key, or null if no factory was overwritten
        See Also:
        defineSimpleFactory

      • defineSimpleFactory

        default <R,I> TaskFactoryConfig<R,I> defineSimpleFactory(TaskFactoryKey<R,I> defKey,
                                                         TaskFactory<R,I> taskFactory)
        Adds a task node factory.

        If a task node factory was already defined with the given key, it will be replaced by the new definition. Even if, it was defined via another defineSimpleFactory method, or another TaskFactoryDefiner of the same TaskGraphDefConfigurer.

        The default implementation simply delegates to the most generic defineFactory method.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the task nodes created by the defined task node factory.
        I - the type of the argument passed to the task node factory when requested for a node to be created
        Parameters:
        defKey - the key uniquely identifying a task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        taskFactory - the task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the task node factory definition previously associated with the given factory key, or null if no factory was overwritten
        See Also:
        defineFactory

      • defineSimpleFactory

        default <R,I> TaskFactoryConfig<R,I> defineSimpleFactory(Class<R> resultType,
                                                         Class<I> factoryArgType,
                                                         TaskFactory<R,I> taskFactory)
        Adds a task node factory. This method is the same as calling the other defineSimpleFactory with a null custom key.

        If a task node factory was already defined with the given key, it will be replaced by the new definition. Even if, it was defined via another defineSimpleFactory method, or another TaskFactoryDefiner of the same TaskGraphDefConfigurer.

        The default implementation simply delegates to the most generic defineFactory method.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the task nodes created by the defined task node factory.
        I - the type of the argument passed to the task node factory when requested for a node to be created
        Parameters:
        resultType - the return type of the task nodes created by the defined task node factory. This argument is part of the key uniquely identifying the task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        factoryArgType - the type of the argument passed to the task node factory when requested for a node to be created. This argument is part of the key uniquely identifying the task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        taskFactory - the task node factory. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the task node factory definition previously associated with the given factory key, or null if no factory was overwritten
        See Also:
        defineFactory
